result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier R Parks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xavier R Parks not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Xavier R Parks.  Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Court adjourns matter for November 18,2022 at 08:30 am to co-side with the co-defendants cases.

Defendant Xavier R Parks not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Xavier R Parks.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State, but needs additional time to review with client. Case adjourned for a status conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Xavier R Parks not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Parties request additional time to work through discovery.  Court schedules a status conference to be held via Zoom.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.
  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Xavier R Parks not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video means. Case is adjourned to track co-defendants case. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Xavier R Parks in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Xavier R Parks in custody. Francesco Mineo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Xavier R Parks not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Xavier R Parks not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
No driving without a valid license.

Court ordered no contact with Shalonn C.; Kristeena M.C.; Terry D.L.; Nora M.; and co-defendants:   Lamar Howard & William Pope
Officers J.L. Cruz & O.L. Sanders (unless in their official capacity as Milwaukee Police Officers)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court also ordered co-defendants kept separate while in custody.

Defendant Xavier R Parks in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Xavier R Parks in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Xavier R Parks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
